H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H4317.def: = man; ► father of {L:Sethur<SDBH:סְתוּר>}, spy; ◄ tribe of {L:Asher<SDBH:אָשֵׁר>}

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H4422.def: = action by which humans move away as fast as possible from a place that is considered insecure ► in order to save their lives

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H3463.def: = state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with death, sometimes with being inactive

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H6974.def: = process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H1860.def: = an object or person that is considered extremely repugnant or loathsome to others

H7919.def: = state in which humans are able to accomplish whatever they attempt to do

H2094.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects intense light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H2096.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects intense light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H7549.def: = something like a rounded vault placed on top of the surface of the earth; separating the water on the earth from the water in the atmosphere; place where sun, moon, and stars are suspended; described in Ezekiel's vision as a structure borne by heavenly creatures, on top of which God's throne was located

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H6663.def: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

H3556.def: = celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H5703.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H1841.def: = man; ► {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}; one of the family heads who accompanied {L:Ezra<SDBH:עֶזְרָא>} back to {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} after the exile; one of the signatories to the {L:covenant<SDBH:בְּרִית>} document of {L:Nehemiah<SDBH:נְחֶמְיָה>}

H2856.def: = to put a seal on a written document; ► in order to confirm that the document is authentic and to keep unauthorized readers from having access to it; ≈ associated with both authenticity and secrecy

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H7093.def: = state of having reached the terminal point of an event

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1841.def: = man; ► {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}; one of the family heads who accompanied {L:Ezra<SDBH:עֶזְרָא>} back to {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} after the exile; one of the signatories to the {L:covenant<SDBH:בְּרִית>} document of {L:Nehemiah<SDBH:נְחֶמְיָה>}

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H312.def: = pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H2975.def: = a river ◄ flowing through Egypt from south to north; ► overflowing its banks each year and providing fertility for the fields on both sides; ≈ generally associated with Egypt's power and prosperity

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H906.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H4605.def: = action by which humans do something to (other) humans or deities that is not in line with the behavior that they committed themselves to

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2975.def: = a river ◄ flowing through Egypt from south to north; ► overflowing its banks each year and providing fertility for the fields on both sides; ≈ generally associated with Egypt's power and prosperity

H4970.def: = reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H7093.def: = state of having reached the terminal point of an event

H6382.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H906.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H4605.def: = action by which humans do something to (other) humans or deities that is not in line with the behavior that they committed themselves to

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2975.def: = a river ◄ flowing through Egypt from south to north; ► overflowing its banks each year and providing fertility for the fields on both sides; ≈ generally associated with Egypt's power and prosperity

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H8040.def: = the side of the human body which is to the north when facing the direction of the rising sun; in extension: one option as opposed to another

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H4150.def: = an action by which two or more parties come together for a particular purpose

H2677.def: = one part of an object or substance that has been divided into two parts

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H113.def: = man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1841.def: = man; ► {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}; one of the family heads who accompanied {L:Ezra<SDBH:עֶזְרָא>} back to {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} after the exile; one of the signatories to the {L:covenant<SDBH:בְּרִית>} document of {L:Nehemiah<SDBH:נְחֶמְיָה>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2856.def: = to put a seal on a written document; ► in order to confirm that the document is authentic and to keep unauthorized readers from having access to it; ≈ associated with both authenticity and secrecy

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H7093.def: = state of having reached the terminal point of an event

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H1305.def: = action by which someone carefully examines a group of objects in order to determine whether they meet certain criteria

H3835.def: literally: to become white; hence: = process by which branches become light in color because they are stripped of their bark

H6884.def: = action by which humans or deities examine the character of humans by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H7561.def: = state in which humans are or are considered to be in a state of guilt before God or humans, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H7919.def: = state in which humans are able to accomplish whatever they attempt to do

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H8251.def: = an object that is regarded as unclean and therefore treated as utterly detestable

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H3967.def: = state in which a countable entity is one hundred in number

H8673.def: = state in which a countable entity is nine in number

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H2442.def: = action by which humans or deities consciously remain in a particular state

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H7969.def: = state in which a countable entity is three in number

H7970.def: = state in which a countable entity is the third in a range

H2568.def: = state in which a countable entity is five in number

H5117.def: = action by which humans or animals stop their current or regular activities, ► often with the purpose of recovering their strength

H1486.def: = specially marked object, such as a pebble or piece of pottery, ► used in order to decide questions
